item.title: Bernadette Walker: Scott Walker guilty of murder
item.description: Scott Walker killed his ex-partner's daughter Bernadette Walker, whose body has never been found.

item.title: Whipps Cross Hospital patients evacuated after flooding
item.description: "Major incident" at Whipps Cross Hospital as fire brigade takes 1,000 flood calls across London.

item.title: Standon Calling festival-goers make most of mud as heavy rain hits
item.description: Organisers of the festival call it off due to flooding and risk of lightning.

item.title: Newly-weds delighted after lost ring found in Windermere
item.description: A diver found the ring after it slipped off the groom's finger into the water on his wedding day.

item.title: Joey Barton denies assaulting his wife Georgia
item.description: The Bristol Rovers manager allegedly left his wife with a head injury in an attack in Kew, London.

item.title: Wayne Rooney reports photos to Greater Manchester Police
item.description: The images appear to show the ex-England footballer asleep with unknown women posing beside him.

item.title: Stonehenge A303 tunnel: High Court challenge bid dismissed
item.description: Campaigners say the ruling is deeply worrying for "anyone hoping for urgent action on climate".

item.title: Ian Paterson: Plans for further breast surgeon compensation
item.description: A further 5,500 patients of Ian Paterson have been identified since he was jailed.

item.title: Sir Richard Sutton: Murder accused pleads not guilty
item.description: Thomas Schreiber is charged with murdering one of UK's richest men, Sir Richard Sutton, in Dorset.

item.title: Mortar bomb find halts Guiseley-Ilkley rail services
item.description: Services were stopped between Guiseley and Ilkley as the "safe" training device was dealt with.

item.title: Coventry patient waited 17 hours on floor for ambulance
item.description: Care home staff fear to move Jean Burgess during her long wait for paramedics.

item.title: Blackpool drug warning: 'High-purity ecstasy' leaves two in hospital
item.description: Two men fell ill after apparently taking drugs containing "a high level of MDMA", police say.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Weed garden wins RHS gold at Tatton Park flower show
item.description: The team behind Weed Thriller want to show that native plants are essential for wildlife.

item.title: Chess: The 12-year-old boy taking the game by storm
item.description: "Shrez" has been playing chess since he was five and wants to become world champion one day.

item.title: Mental health: Derbyshire man pulls sack of coal to Newcastle
item.description: Ben Robertson pulls coal 120 miles to Newcastle to raise awareness of mental health.

item.title: The young imam using Instagram to change opinions
item.description: Sabah Ahmedi wants to show imams can "have a laugh", have "a bit of banter" and "wear colourful socks".

item.title: 'People have never seen anything like this before'
item.description: Live-streamed footage of a family of blue tits has had more than 41 million views online.

item.title: Nissan reveals 400 new jobs in manufacturing at Sunderland plant
item.description: Earlier this month the Japanese carmaker said it was was investing £1bn in the site.

item.title: Measham car boot sale evacuated after battery mistaken for bomb
item.description: The suspicious package found in the car park was later identified as a mobility scooter battery.

item.title: Bristol to Weston-super-Mare rail services reduced due to staff isolating
item.description: GWR Bristol to Weston-super-Mare services will be reduced on weekdays and Saturdays until 13 August.

item.title: Man charged after car hits pedestrians near Blackpool pier
item.description: A 30-year-old man is charged with attempted murder after a car hit a group near a Blackpool pier.

item.title: Tramlines 2021: Musicians 'overwhelmed' as festival returns
item.description: Organisers say it was "incredible" to see people back with their friends, enjoying the music.

item.title: Tom Daley: The boy with the Olympic dream that came true
item.description: The 'baby' of Beijing became a father, a husband and an LGBTQ+ spokesperson. And now Tom Daley is an Olympic gold medallist. This is his story.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty becomes two-time Olympic champion - immortality next?
item.description: Adam Peaty won 100m breaststroke gold on Monday to become a double Olympic champion - and there's plenty more to come from the Briton.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gold medals for Team GB's Adam Peaty, Tom Daley and Matty Lee, and Tom Pidcock
item.description: Day three of the Tokyo Olympics was 'Magic Monday' for Team GB with three golds - for divers Tom Daley and Matty Lee, swimmer Adam Peaty and Tom Pidcock in mountain biking.
